intro: Senecio scabrellus, commonly known as the roughleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Senecio scabrellus is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
